title: Video: Alt-J – Fitzpleasure
body:
[![](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/09/triangle+alt-j-260x260.jpg "triangle+alt-j")](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/17904-video-alt-j-fitzpleasure/attachment/trianglealt-j/)Continuing to ride on the crest of the great wave of hype, and fresh off the back of a [Mercury Prize nomination](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/17887-news-mercury-prize-2012-shortlist-revealed/), **Alt-J** have dropped their newest video to ‘Fitzpleasure’, the _Last Exit to Brooklyn_\-inspired track from this year’s _An Awesome Wave_. Much like the band’s video to ‘Tessellate’, it’s a gothic mix of religious imagery and gang culture, and serves as not only a beautifully fitting video to the darkest track on the album, but also – through its top quality production values – gives an inkling as to just how successful the band have become. Check it out below.

[ALT-J “Fitzpleasure”](http://vimeo.com/49246286) from [COSA](http://vimeo.com/cosa) on [Vimeo](http://vimeo.com).
